page.title: 07INDUSTRY
page.content: Although coal mining was once by far the main industry in Barnsley, many coal mines have now been closed because the coal has been worked out.However,Redbrook Colliery is one which has just been extended at a cost of Â£34m.New administrative offices have been built. There is a lamp room where miners collect their lamps before going down the mine. A new shaft has been sunk, much wider than the old one. Two large cages, holding 70 men, carry the miners up and down. In the winding room, the "winders" control the movement of the cages, by turning the huge wheel to which cables from the cages are attached.There are new baths where the miners wash after their shift in the mine and a warehouse where new equipment is kept, such as helmets, boots,explosives and tools.
